alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 11:14PM CDT until further notice by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wisconsin River At Portage affecting Columbia County. .The Wisconsin River at Portage rose to Moderate Flood Stage. Upcoming rain and snow melt after accumulating snow Sunday night into Monday will help the river to remain at moderate flood stage until Monday night. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wisconsin River at Portage. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Floodwaters affect River Shores Road about 3 miles upstream of Portage in the Town of Lewiston and River Oaks Road about 7 miles downstream of Portage in the Town of Dekorra in Columbia County. Water over Levee Rd, Wood St, and Tritz Rd. There is widespread flooding of roads in the Blackhawk Park Area including West Lake Road...Blackhawk Road and Wood Street. The Blackhawk Park area is on the south side of the river about 3 miles south of Portage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 PM CDT Saturday was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.4 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall early Wednesday afternoon. It will rise to 17.9 feet Friday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.4 feet on 12/07/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 1 am... Location stage stage stage/time Mon Tue Wed Thu Portage 17.0 12.7 18.20 11 pm 4/15 18.4 18.4 17.9 17.9 - Highest 24 hour change - observed in river stage - stage in (ft.) up to Highest stage - the last latest observed forecast in - 7 days stage next 7 days Portage 18.2 11 pm 4/15 0.47 18.40 7 am 4/18 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning.Sunday morning at 1115 AM CDT.
